page.title: 16CHURCHES
page.content:
The main churches are Church of England and Roman Cathloic. Each has its own parish priest. In Rottingdean the Norman Church is built of Sussex flint stone and dedicated to St. Margaret. It has a long history, and the stained glass windows are by Edward Burne-Jones the Victorian artist.
The Roman Catholic Church of our Lady of Lourdes was built in the 1950's also of flint stone. The Norman church in Ovingdean is dedicated to St. Wulfran and the Saltdean Church to St. Nicholas. There are also Non Conformist chapels, and also a Roman Catholic convent.
